name: h5z-zfp

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
A highly flexible floating point and integer compression plugin for the
HDF5 library using ZFP compression.

dependencies.name: hdf5
dependencies.description:
HDF5 is a data model, library, and file format for storing and managing
data. It supports an unlimited variety of datatypes, and is designed for
flexible and efficient I/O and for high volume and complex data.

dependencies.name: mpi
dependencies.description:
An open source Message Passing Interface implementation. The Open MPI
Project is an open source Message Passing Interface implementation that
is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and
industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise,
technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance
Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available.
Open MPI offers advantages for system and software vendors, application
developers and computer science researchers.

dependencies.name: zfp
dependencies.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.

dependent_to.name: sw4
dependent_to.description: This package builds SW4 with MPI, OpenMP, HDF5, FFTW, PROJ, and ZFP.

dependent_to.name: conduit
dependent_to.description:
Conduit is an open source project from Lawrence Livermore National
Laboratory that provides an intuitive model for describing hierarchical
scientific data in C++, C, Fortran, and Python. It is used for data
coupling between packages in-core, serialization, and I/O tasks.
